CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, April 6, 1957, pg. 1 reads: "2,000 at Opening Night - A jam-packed crowd of 2,000 persons attended the opening night of The Courier Home Service Fair at Syria Mosque, Tuesday night. Here is shown part of the throng flocked around the New Diamond market booth to receive jars of spaghetti given away by manager Charles Glick to the first 300 women to visit his booth.  The fair, one of the best ever presented in Pittsburgh, will close tonight (Thursday, March 21).  It will  be the biggest prize night of the fair and another capacity crowd is expected. - Harris photo."
TitMainTitle: Crowd gathered in front of the New Diamond Market booth in the Syria Mosque for the 1957 Pittsburgh Courier Home Service Fair, another version
